means: 雇员，专为金钱而工作者

sentence.Network_en: He had no authority; he was merely a hireling.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没有权力; 他只是个受雇者.

sentence.Network_en: The horse is only a hireling.
They would rather be a hireling in this world than wield kingly power among the dead.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们宁可在阳世为奴,也不愿在冥府为王.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from hire + -ling, on the pattern of Dutch huurling

entry.tran: 受雇做坏事的人;听钱使唤的人
entry.def: If you refer to someone as a hireling, you disapprove of them because they do not care who they work for and they are willing to do illegal or immoral things as long as they are paid.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who works only for money
